greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of connected bipartite graphs on n unlabeled nodes with a distinguished bipartite block.
comment: Essentially the same as A007776. - _Georg Fischer_, Oct 02 2018
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..50
example: a(1) = 2 because the single node can either be in the distinguished bipartite block or not.
a(2) = 1 because the only connected bipartite graph on two nodes is the complete graph on two nodes.
a(3) = 2 because the only connected bipartite graph on three nodes is the path graph on three nodes and there is a choice about which nodes are in the distinguished block.
mathematica: EULERi[b_] := Module[{a, c, i, d}, c = {}; For[i = 1, i <= Length[b], i++, c = Append[c, i*b[[i]] - Sum[c[[d]]*b[[i - d]], {d, 1, i - 1}]]]; a = {}; For[i = 1, i <= Length[b], i++, a = Append[a, (1/i)*Sum[mob[i, d]*c[[d]], {d, 1, i}]]]; Return[a]];
b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0, {0}, If[i < 1, {}, Flatten @ Table[Map[ Function[{p}, p + j*x^i], b[n - i*j, i - 1]], {j, 0, n/i}]]];

g[n_, k_] := g[n, k] = Sum[Sum[2^Sum[Sum[GCD[i, j]*Coefficient[s, x, i]* Coefficient[t, x, j], {j, 1, Exponent[t, x]}], {i, 1, Exponent[s, x]}]/ Product[i^Coefficient[s, x, i]*Coefficient[s, x, i]!, {i, 1, Exponent[s, x]}]/Product[i^Coefficient[t, x, i]*Coefficient[t, x, i]!, {i, 1, Exponent[t, x]}], {t, b[n + k, n + k]}], {s, b[n, n]}];
A[n_, k_] := g[Min[n, k], Abs[n - k]];
Join[{1}, EULERi[Array[b, 23]]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 13 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ in A049312 *)
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 04 2018
